page.title: 01North Downs, Hastingleigh
page.content: An area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) & is wholly agricultural, mainly arable & sheep country with some dairy & stock raising. Fortunately coppicing is still practiced (15-20 yr intervals) mainly chestnut but some hazel & ash for fencing & firewood. After coppicing the bluebells & foxgloves return & butterflies & birds are encouraged by the new growth. There are very many badgers. There are about 250-300 people in the block, apart form Hastingleigh (about 150) living scattered small groups of houses & farms. It is a close, friendly & caring community, no home help has ever been needed, the community "mucks in". The village hall is well used by various organisations.
